Columbia.Hammond School (South Carolina):
Hammond School, originally James H. Hammond Academy, is a pre-K through 12 college preparatory day school in Columbia, South Carolina, founded in 1966. The school has a controversial history as a segregation academy, but is now better known for its athletic and academic accomplishments.


== History ==

The school was founded in 1966 as a segregation academy in response to the court ordered racial integration of public schools.
